page.title: 06FLEETWOOD MOUNT: PART TWO.
page.content: by Vikki Taylor My mother told me that at the back of the Mount years ago there was a playground with swings and slides. At Easter, on Easter Sunday, all the children used to paint hard-boiled eggs and roll them down in front of the Mount. The grass was covered with daisies in the summer and she used to make daisy chains. You could still walk round the inside of the pavilion and the old, outside swimming pool was still there. At Easter I still roll eggs from the top to the bottom of the Mount. The playground, dismantled when I was 7 because it had been vandalized, has been rebuilt and directly opposite the Mount there is now a Leisure Centre, an amusement arcade called Corrigans and a new Surf Divers' Club. The Mount still means fun for children in 1985.
